p: The high concentrations of thymol, carvacrol, and p-cymene are consistent with the traditional uses of Monarda spp. to treat skin infections, wounds, fevers, and respiratory problems. Thymol [ 31], carvacrol [ 32], and p-cymene [ 33] have demonstrated antibacterial and antifungal activities [ 34, 35], as well as wound-healing activity [ 36]. Thymol [ 37] and carvacrol [ 38], in addition to thymoquinone [ 39], have shown antitussive effects. Thymoquinone has also shown wound-healing properties [ 40]. Furthermore, both thymol [ 41] and carvacrol [ 32] have shown analgesic and anti-inflammatory activities [ 42].
